title: Human cloning: Good or Bad?
content: Since Dolly the Sheep was cloned in 1996, the question of whether human reproductive cloning should be banned or pursued has been the subject of national and international debates. Feelings run strong on both sides. Yet, despite its relevance, governments around the world did not address the topic for many years.
lead: While this changed in 2015, there has been no real progress on the issue. To this day, the idea of cloning human beings continues to stir emotion and trigger debate, as what was once science fiction has now become technically possible. Do we have anything to gain or lose from this technology? How would human cloning affect our daily lives?
